page.title: 15ALL SAINTS WINTERSLOW
page.content: THERE HAS BEEN A CHURCH ON THIS SITE SINCE SAXON TIMES AND WINTERSLOW PEOPLE STILL WORSHIP GOD HERE. THE OLDEST REMAINING PARTS OF THE BUILDING ARE TWO NORMAN ARCHES AND A NORMAN FONT. THE CHURCH WAS ENLARGED IN THE 19TH CENTURY AND NOW HOLDS ABOUT 250 PEOPLE. THE ORGAN WAS RESTORED IN 1982. THE FOUR BELLS ARE RUNG EVERY SUNDAY. THE PRESENT RECTOR IS THE REV. CLIVE COHEN. A SERVICE OF PARISH COMMUNION IS HELD EVERY SUNDAY AT 10A.M. AND EVENSONG IS SAID ON TWO SUNDAYS EACH MONTH. ABOUT FORTY CHILDREN ATTEND SUNDAY SCHOOL AND THERE IS A BRANCH OF THE MOTHERS' UNION.
